publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-2181 Colin Fox: Forth Rail Bridge—That the Parliament supports the bid for World Heritage Site status for the Forth Rail Bridge; recognises the magnificent feat of engineering involved in the construction of the Forth Rail Bridge; acknowledges the dedication, hard work and skill of the working men who built the Forth Rail Bridge; regrets that in the construction of the bridge 57 men lost their lives; calls on the Scottish Executive to recognise these facts within the context of the symbol of Scotland that the bridge represents, and further calls on the Executive to erect a plaque in memory of those workers who lost their lives in the construction.

S2M-2181 Colin Fox: Forth Rail Bridge—That the Parliament supports the bid for World Heritage Site status for the Forth Rail Bridge; recognises the magnificent feat of engineering involved in the construction of the Forth Rail Bridge; acknowledges the dedication, hard work and skill of the working men who built the Forth Rail Bridge; regrets that in the construction of the bridge 57 men lost their lives; calls on the Scottish Executive to recognise these facts within the context of the symbol of Scotland that the bridge represents, and further calls on the Executive to erect a plaque in memory of those workers who lost their lives in the construction. Supported by: Tommy Sheridan*
S2M-2181 Forth Rail Bridge (lodged on 16 December 2004) Donald Gorrie*
S2M-2181 Forth Rail Bridge (lodged on 16 December 2004) Nora Radcliffe*
S2M-2181 Forth Rail Bridge (lodged on 16 December 2004) Ms Sandra White*
S2M-2181 Forth Rail Bridge (lodged on 16 December 2004) Linda Fabiani*
S2M-2181 Forth Rail Bridge (lodged on 16 December 2004) John Swinburne*
S2M-2181 Forth Rail Bridge (lodged on 16 December 2004) Elaine Smith*
